thread.title: Sutton's Bailey preparing for Arsenal with McDonald's
thread.title_full: Sutton's Bailey preparing for Arsenal with McDonald's | Daily Mail Online

author: Matthew Smith For Mailonline
title: Sutton's Bailey preparing for Arsenal with McDonald's
text:
Sutton United veteran Nicky Bailey has revealed what his pre-match preparation for Arsenal will be - a visit to McDonald's for some chicken nuggets.
National League part-timers Sutton will take on the Gunners on Monday night hoping to cause what would go down as the biggest upset in FA Cup history.
However Bailey, whose former clubs include Charlton Athletic and Middlesbrough, will shun any suggestion of copying the Premier League stars' nutrition based preparations and instead stick to the fast food approach which he claims has served him well in his career so far.
Sutton United's Nicky Bailey has revealed his preparation for Arsenal - chicken nuggets
National League part-timers Sutton will take on the Gunners on Monday night in the FA Cup
CV: NICKY BAILEY Age: 32
Position: Central defender/midfielder
Clubs: Sutton United (twice), Barnet (twice), Southend United, Charlton Athletic, Middlesbrough, Millwall
Games: 420; Goals: 58
Highest transfer fee: £1.4million from Charlton to Boro in July 2010
The 32-year-old told the Sun: 'My diet has got me to where I am today - I am not the best eater.
'I don't think I've ever had a salad in my life, or a vegetable. It's always worked for me. My pre-match meal is always a McDonald's - nine nuggets.
'When I was younger, my mum used to try and make me eat the green stuff, but I used to sick it up.
'When you can get away with it, you do that. When you get older, it catches up with you, but I've done all right.'
Bailey is back at the club where he started his career, before touring the Football League with Barnet, Southend United, Charlton, Boro and Millwall.
He is now back at the part-timers currently sat 17th in English football's fifth tier, who stunned Leeds United to book the plum fifth round tie against Arsenal.
Bailey started at Sutton before a career which included a £1.4m move to Middlesbrough
